definition: line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already

sentences.english: The result of occupational disease checkup should be announced to trade union.
sentences.chinese: 并及时向工会通报职业病检查情况。

sentences.english: Pneumoconiosis is the most severe occupational disease for industrial production in Chi- na.
sentences.chinese: 尘肺是我国工业生产中危害最严重的职业病。

sentences.english: To learn the status of occupational disease hazard program reports in Luohu District of Shenzhen.
sentences.chinese: 目的了解深圳市罗湖区职业病危害项目申报情况。

sentences.english: ObjectiveIn our country, silicosis is the most serious vocational diseases that is harmful to workers.
sentences.chinese: 目的在我国，矽肺病是危害工人健康最严重的职业病。

sentences.english: Those interviewed cited a total of 27 work-related symptoms.
sentences.chinese: 这些受访者共列举了27种职业病症状。

sentences.english: Objective To evaluate the effect of application of humane nursing in patients with work-related disease.
sentences.chinese: 目的评价人性化护理在职业病病人中的应用效果。

sentences.english: The main occupational hazard is carpal tunnel syndrome.
sentences.chinese: 主要的职业病是腕骨综合症。

sentences.english: Optimism is an occupational hazard of programming. Feedback is the treatment.
sentences.chinese: 乐观是编程人员的职业病，而反馈则是解药。

sentences.english: The occupational diseases are not found in mineral drivers.
sentences.chinese: 矿运司机未发现职业病。

sentences.english: EHC continuously monitors and, if necessary, adjusts these procedures to best prevent occupational illness and injury.
sentences.chinese: 依合斯持续监控和调整流程来防止职业病和职业伤害。

pinyin: yao1 zhui1 jian1 pan2 tu1 chu1

definition: karoshi (loanword from Japanese), death from overwork
to be crippled (in an accident etc)

overweight from overwork (the supposition that white collar workers become fat as a consequence of factors associated with being under pressure at work, including irregular diet, lack of exercise and inadequate rest)

pinyin: yao1 zhui1 jian1 pan2 tu1 chu1 zheng4
